column4: Help! I reinstalled windows after I accidently deleted it, so now I am making a dual boot for ubuntu and windows, but how do I rename my windows hard drive to C:\?
it has to be your IDE primary master
there is a reassign drive id function in windows
I think you'll find it in the disk manager tool, but I'm not a windows expert
indeed, windows is a royal PITA
can't you reinstall your nvidia driver so it thinks it is drive d:, or whatever?
why do you think i got ubuntu ;)
no when I open the exe it says "drive c doesnt exist"
you mean the install program says that?
hmm.  I don't have an answer for that, at least not off the top of my head.
first of all, who said it is "supposed" to be better?  it is different
if you want something that doesn't require learning, go with osx
No, I like it. It's just that I guess it has a steep learning curb?
same answer, for some flavors and platforms of unix
it's an emulator.  why shouldn't it run under windows?
WHy would someone need to run a windows emulator under windows?
